item.title: Let's Write Redux
item.description: This is a copy of a post, originally written on Medium. I've since rehosted it on my own site. As a corollary to the famous sentiment ‚Äúthe best way to prove mastery over a topic is to be able to teach it to somebody else‚Äù, I‚Äôd like to add ‚Äúthe best way to prove mastery over a piece of software it to implement it yourself.‚Äù I don‚Äôt know whether or not that‚Äôs true, but I do often enjoy building my own versions of the tools/libraries that I use.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hey, I'm Ken! Nice to meet you üëã I'm a Senior Software Engineer working in NYC who's passionate about programming, motivated by curiosity, and who wishes he were better at guitar. On my honeymoon in France, about to dig into a wonderful crepe By day, I typically write in Ruby, Go, and Typescript (using React); by night, I like to work on a variety of projects, most recently my programming language Abra, which is written in Rust.
